Package org.jdesktop.swing.animation.demos

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    ClickAndGo
    This demonstration uses property setters to create a "to" animation using the Timing Framework.
    ClickAndGo.Ball  
    DiscreteInterpolationTest
    A Swing application that demonstrates use of a DiscreteInterpolator using KeyFrames within a PropertySetter animation.
    FadingButtonTF
    A demonstration of a fading button using the Timing Framework.
    RaceBasic
    The simplest version of the race track animation.
    RaceBasicNonLinear
    Simple subclass of RaceBasic that uses a AccelerationInterpolator to give a non-linear motion effect to the car's movement.
    RaceCompleteMultiStep
    The full-blown demo with all of the bells and whistles.
    RaceControlPanel
    Go/Stop buttons to control the animation
    RaceGUI
    The GUI used by all of the different race demos.
    RaceTrackView
    This class does the work of rendering the current view of the racetrack.
    SplineInterpolatorTest
    A Swing application that compares the elapsed fraction, in real time, to the elapsed fraction when using a sample SplineInterpolator.
    TimingSourceResolution
    A Swing application that outputs benchmarks of the available TimingSource implementations.
    TooManyBallsBroken
    This demonstration is a variant of the demonstration by Chet Haase at JavaOne 2008.
    Triggers
    Simple program that demonstrates the use of several different Trigger implementations available in the Timing Framework.
    Triggers.SpherePanel
    This class encapsulates both the rendering of a sphere, at a location that may be animating, and the animation that drives the sphere movement.
    TwoButtonShimmy
    A demonstration of moving buttons using the Timing Framework.
